cross.name: Cross
cross.description: The cross is a powerful straight punch thrown with your back hand, typically following a jab. It travels directly across the body, aiming to pierce the opponent's guard with speed and force. Often used as a finishing strike in combos.
procedure: Starting Stance: Maintain a balanced boxing stance with your hands up to protect your chin, elbows tucked.
Footwork & Rotation: Push off your back foot, pivoting on the ball of that foot (heel lifts).
Hip & Shoulder Turn: Rotate your hips and shoulders powerfully towards the target, transferring weight to your front foot.
Snap back to guard

jab.name: Jab
jab.description: The jab is a quick straight punch thrown with your front hand. It's used to set up combinations, control distance, and disrupt the opponent's rhythm. Fast, snappy, and fundamental to boxing.
procedure: Starting Stance: Maintain a balanced boxing stance with hands up protecting your chin.
Arm Extension: Extend your front arm straight forward with a quick snap.
Hip Rotation: Rotate your hips slightly to generate power through your core.
Snap back to guard immediately

whitebeltworkout2.name: White Belt Workout #2
whitebeltworkout2.description: A fundamental combination workout for white belt students, integrating basic punching and kicking techniques to build foundational skills and coordination.
procedure: jab

jumpingJacks.name: Jumping Jacks
jumpingJacks.description: Jumping jacks are a full-body conditioning exercise that increases heart rate and improves coordination. Essential warm-up movement for building cardiovascular endurance.
procedure: Start standing upright with your legs together and arms at your sides.
Jump while spreading your legs shoulder-width apart and raising your arms above your head.
Jump again to return to the starting position.

cartwheelKick.name: Cartwheel Kick
cartwheelKick.description: The cartwheel kick is an advanced spinning kick that combines acrobatic movement with a powerful strike. It uses momentum and height to deliver force while maintaining balance and control.
procedure: Starting Position: Stand in fighting stance, facing your target.
Hand Plant: Place your hands on the ground while rotating your body sideways.
Weight Transfer: Shift weight through your hands as you cartwheel.
Leg Extension: Drive your back leg up and forward to strike the target as you complete the rotation.
Landing: Return to fighting stance with control

kneeStrike.name: Knee Strike
kneeStrike.description: The knee strike is a close-range powerful technique using the knee to strike the opponent's midsection, head, or legs. Effective in clinch situations and devastating when executed with proper hip drive.
procedure: Clinch Position: Move into close range and control your opponent's posture.
Hip Drive: Thrust your hips forward powerfully toward the target.
Knee Lift: Raise your knee explosively, driving it straight into the target.
Chamber Back: Return your knee to starting position while maintaining clinch control

roundKick.name: Round Kick
roundKick.description: The round kick is a sweeping circular kick that generates power through hip rotation and leg flexibility. It's one of the most versatile kicks, effective against multiple targets and angles.
procedure: Starting Stance: Stand in fighting stance with hands protecting face.
Chamber: Lift your knee up and rotate your hips toward the target.
Leg Extension: Extend your leg in a circular arc, striking with your shin or instep.
Follow Through: Complete the rotation and return to guard position

spinningBackKick.name: Spinning Back kick
spinningBackKick.description: The spinning back kick is a powerful rear-facing kick that uses 180-degree rotation to generate tremendous force. It's one of the most devastating strikes in kickboxing when timed correctly.
procedure: Starting Stance: Begin in fighting stance facing your opponent.
Head Check: Look over your shoulder while rotating your hips and body.
Push-Off: Pivot on your front foot, rotating 180 degrees explosively.
Leg Drive: Extend your back leg straight backward, striking with your heel.
Return: Rotate back to guard position with hands up

spinningHookKick.name: Spinning Hook Kick
spinningHookKick.description: The spinning hook kick is a rotational kick that curves around the opponent's guard. The spinning momentum combined with the hooking arc makes it difficult to defend and highly effective.
procedure: Starting Stance: Stand in fighting stance with hands protecting.
Initiate Spin: Pivot on your front foot, beginning to rotate away from opponent.
Check Over Shoulder: Look back at target while rotating hips and upper body.
Leg Chamber: Lift your rear leg knee up as you complete the rotation.
Hook Strike: Extend leg in a curved hook motion, striking with shin or instep.
Return to Guard: Complete rotation back to fighting stance
